intro: Iostephane heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf stephanea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its diverse leaf shapes, which vary depending on environmental conditions. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
